name: WHO'S THE ROSS?
bio:
"WHO'S THE ROSS?" is Portland's longest running late-night talk show, having logged 626 live performances in the past 8 years. 

Imagine Conan with cocktails!

Each show presents a brand-new mixture of comedy, music, and interviews, incorporating elements of improv, sketch, stand-up, and musical comedy. 

WTR's Bridgetown show(s) will feature performances by comedians from the festival, as well as a top-notch Portland musical guest backed by our very talented jazz-funk house-band, "THEM! THE BAND!" Guests personality, background, and experience will be on full display in sit-down interviews, conducted post performance, also featuring an absurd game or contest, ala Fallon's "Tonight Show." 

In addition to the guests from Bridgetown, WTR's festival performance will be tailor made to the event, exclusively written and constructed for this engagement.
copy:
"WHO'S THE ROSS?" is Portland's longest running late-night talk show, having logged 626 shows in the past 8 years. 

Imagine Conan with cocktails!

Each show presents a brand-new mixture of comedy, music, and interviews, incorporating elements of improv, sketch, stand-up, and musical comedy. 

A born & bred Portlander, Aaron Ross is also the host of the "You Who!" rock n roll kid's show, Pickathon's "Seriously?!" comedy series, stars in the new web-series "Training Wheels," and has performed at Comedy Central Live & SXSW (2013-2016).
